nodejs_backend.purpose: RAILGUN cryptographic operations in native environment
nodejs_backend.isolation: Separate Node.js process for privacy computations

key_directories.src/react-shared: Shared business logic between mobile and desktop
key_directories.src/hooks: React hooks for state and side effects

proof_types: Unshield proofs - Private to public conversion
Shield proofs - Public to private conversion
Cross-contract call proofs - Private DeFi interactions

transaction_privacy.sender_privacy: Optional sender address reveal to recipient

wallet_creation.railgun_wallet: Derived from mnemonic via RAILGUN SDK

storage.encryption: Database encryption key derived from user PIN/password

security_model.private_keys: Stored encrypted, never exposed to main thread
security_model.encryption_key: Derived from user credentials, not stored

code_sharing.platform_specific: UI layer, native modules, build configs

proof_generation_flow: 4. Node.js backend calls RAILGUN SDK proof generation
zero_knowledge_proof_integration.gas_estimation: Unproven gas estimates before proof generation

transaction_privacy_mechanisms.shield_flow: Public ERC20 → Private RAILGUN balance via shield contract
transaction_privacy_mechanisms.unshield_flow: Private RAILGUN balance → Public ERC20 via unshield proof
transaction_privacy_mechanisms.transfer_flow: Private RAILGUN → Private RAILGUN with encrypted details
transaction_privacy_mechanisms.cross_contract_flow: Private balance → DeFi interaction → Private balance return
transaction_privacy_mechanisms.merkletree_sync: Event scanning for UTXO set updates

key_management_security.encryption_at_rest: AES encryption via encrypted storage APIs
key_management_security.encryption_key_derivation: PBKDF2 with user PIN/password as passphrase
key_management_security.key_isolation: Private keys never leave Node.js backend

crypto_polyfills.mobile: React Native crypto shims (react-native-crypto, buffer, stream-browserify)

defi_integration.privacy_preservation: Unshield → Interact → Re-shield in single proof

mitigations.key_isolation: Private keys isolated in Node.js backend

private_key_handling.generation: Secure random via platform crypto APIs
private_key_handling.access_control: Requires authentication for each wallet operation
private_key_handling.exposure_risk: Low - keys never passed to UI layer
private_key_handling.mnemonic_display: Only shown during backup, requires authentication

zk_snark_circuit_security.wallet_responsibility: Correct SDK usage, no custom circuits

audit_status.wallet_audits: No independent Railway Wallet audit found in repository
audit_status.railgun_sdk_audits: RAILGUN Protocol has been audited (external dependency)

critical_dependencies.railgun_sdk: Trust in external SDK for core privacy
critical_dependencies.nodejs_mobile: Complex native module - potential attack vector
critical_dependencies.crypto_libraries: Relies on platform crypto - implementation dependent

identified_concerns: No security.md file with responsible disclosure policy
Desktop auto-update disabled - manual updates may delay security patches
Large attack surface with 115+ npm dependencies (mobile)
Electron version 24.3.0 - should monitor for CVEs
positive_findings: Private keys isolated from UI thread
No hardcoded secrets found in code review

data_privacy.analytics: No analytics libraries found in dependencies

metadata_leakage.rpc_calls: User IP visible to RPC provider (can use custom RPC)
metadata_leakage.broadcaster: Transaction metadata shared with selected broadcaster
metadata_leakage.mitigation: User choice of RPC and broadcaster

unit_tests.assessment: CRITICAL ISSUE: No test files found in codebase scan

readme_files.root: Basic project description and license notice

code_comments.todo_comments: Only 1 TODO/FIXME comment found in entire codebase

documentation.architecture_docs: Not found - no docs/ directory with architecture diagrams

structure.modularity: Well-organized by feature (services, views, hooks, models)
structure.separation_of_concerns: Good - UI separated from business logic
structure.shared_code: Excellent - react-shared module enables code reuse

file_sizes.concerns: 4+ files exceed 500 lines - potential maintainability issues

key_rules: no-console: warn - Discourages console.log in production

dependency_constraints.alignment: rnx-kit for React Native dependency alignment

concerns: Large dependency tree - increases attack surface

scripts.lint: Runs ESLint, TypeScript, and circular dependency checks

performance_considerations.zk_proof_generation: CPU-intensive - runs in isolated Node.js thread
performance_considerations.large_bundle_size: Likely large due to crypto polyfills and dependencies
performance_considerations.balance_updates: Redux state updates may cause re-renders

weaknesses: Complex transaction logic in utility files
priority_improvements: Add comprehensive unit test suite (80+ hours)
Refactor large files into smaller modules (40 hours)
Add code comments and API docs (40 hours)

overall_assessment.summary: Railway Wallet demonstrates a well-architected multi-platform application with strong privacy integration through the RAILGUN Protocol. The codebase shows good separation of concerns, excellent TypeScript configuration, and effective code reuse across platforms. However, it suffers from a critical lack of automated testing, insufficient documentation, and some maintainability issues from overly large files. The security model is sound with proper key isolation and encrypted storage, but the project would benefit from formal security audits and automated dependency scanning.

critical_issues.impact: High risk of regressions and bugs in production
critical_issues.recommendation: Implement comprehensive test suite with >80% coverage
Refactor large components into smaller, focused modules

critical_issues.impact: Difficult for new contributors to understand architecture
critical_issues.recommendation: Add architecture diagrams and API documentation

positive_findings: Excellent RAILGUN SDK integration with proper proof isolation
Strong TypeScript and ESLint configuration prevents common bugs
Proper key management with encryption at rest
AGPL-3.0 license enables community security review
Clean Redux architecture for state management

refactoring_opportunities.recommendation: Split into smaller components: ReviewHeader, ReviewBody, ReviewFooter, TransactionDetails, FeeEstimation
Extract transaction parsing, validation, and serialization into separate modules
Separate public and private balance logic into distinct services
Split into token validation, token formatting, and token conversion utilities

security_recommendations: Conduct third-party security audit of wallet implementation
Add SECURITY.md with responsible disclosure policy
Enable Dependabot for automated dependency updates
Consider bug bounty program for community security testing
Document threat model and security assumptions
Add security-focused integration tests for key management
Implement automated static analysis security testing (SAST)
Monitor RAILGUN SDK updates for security patches
testing_recommendations: Add integration tests for RAILGUN proof flows
Implement E2E tests for critical user journeys (shield, unshield, transfer)
Add security-focused tests for key management
Test error handling in proof generation failures
Add performance tests for proof generation times
Mock RAILGUN SDK for faster unit tests
Add regression tests for transaction parsing
documentation_recommendations: Add sequence diagrams for proof generation flow
Create contributor guide with setup instructions
Add inline JSDoc comments for complex functions

strengths_vs_competitors: Open source with permissive AGPL license
areas_for_improvement: Documentation less comprehensive than some alternatives
No formal security audit published (vs. audited competitors)
Larger codebase complexity than some minimal wallets
